occupation: VP, Social Good and Nonprofit Partnerships at Dataminr
headline: VP, Social Good @ Dataminr, Exec Sponsor of Womxn@ ERG
summary:
Mission-driven intrapreneur with extensive experience in technology and social impact. Currently leading social good efforts at Dataminr, a 2019 Forbes AI 50 helping NGOs make the world safer through real-time event and emerging risk detection. 

Proud ex-Googler, Duolingo fledgling and Returned Peace Corps Volunteer. Strengths in consultative sales, business development, digital strategy and storytelling, hiring and coaching teams, building cultures and systems, and launching social-impact-focused products and programs. 

Interests in sustainable development, future of work/edu, DEI & B, and human-centered technology and design. 

Hablo español. Falo português.

experiences.title: VP, Social Good and Nonprofit Partnerships
experiences.location: New York, New York, United States

experiences.title: Sabbatical
experiences.description:
Consulted with startups in edtech, ethical e-commerce, workforce development, and DE&I. Projects included product & monetization strategy, concept testing, and storytelling for fundraising success.

As Chief Revenue and Culture Officer In-residence at Girls Auto Clinic, I implemented people and culture best practices, led revenue operations as well as OKR setting and reviews, and researched and brought new products/services to market. Girls Auto Clinic is the world's first automotive repair and education brand catered to womxn.

Edited and illustrated book of haiku; worked on a novel that's part family memoir, part magical realism (think Lincoln in the Bardo meets The Humans); and began a YA novel inspired by my time in Nicaragua. Otherwise, volunteered and made time for the things a rewarding career had somewhat delayed. Thanks to the business leaders, mentors, colleagues and friends who supported me in taking this time.

experiences.title: Director, Partnerships and Sales
experiences.description: Launched world's first "teach your brand" engagement ad products, collaborating with UX and Eng leads. Hired and led sales team. Negotiated agreements with clients, partners, audience insights providers and other vendors. Established L&D sales trainings, variable compensation models and forecasting systems. Key contributor on Duolingo’s Something Like Home campaign. Explored partnership opportunities with global travel, entertainment, sports and nonprofit brands, including UNHCR and UNICEF.

experiences.title: Intrapreneur / Area 120 Candidate
experiences.description: Co-founder of KidQuest, a gaming app designed to transform kid tech from "babysitter" to bonding agent for parent and child. Content aimed at nurturing curiosity, creativity and empathy among children ages 3-10, the next billion users. KidQuest was one of 50 of 900+ applicants selected to pitch the VPs and Principals of Area 120, Google's internal incubator.

experiences.title: Head of Industry, Nonprofits
experiences.description: Launched Google's first consultative sales team dedicated to the nonprofit sector. Hired and coached a team of seven world-class sales, marketing and analytics professionals, growing business 230% and averaging 104% to quota across five years. Led quota-setting and annual and quarterly OKR setting and reviews. Drove customer relationships with key executives. Developed and executed ambitious growth strategy, including designing and packaging original industry research, creating industry advisory board, launching new products (e.g. YouTube donate button), marketing and PR. Co-founded ZOO for Good, an innovative program bringing Google's top creatives and leading edge technologies to bear on some of the world's most pressing problems.

experiences.title: Global Rotation, Brand Unit (formerly "The ZOO")
experiences.description: Creative business partner for global and Brazilian brands, including working on campaigns for the 2016 Olympic Games. Created vetting framework and client charter for Google LatAm to help sales teams better prioritize and strengthen creative partnerships.

experiences.title: MBA Venture Fellow
experiences.description: Reviewed applications for the 2010 Social Venture Fair pitch competition, evaluating leadership teams, business models, and market opportunities of 15 startups.

experiences.title: Youth Programs Manager
experiences.description: Created and executed plan for Youth Division’s fee-based consulting practice, growing contract revenue by 50%. Developed service-learning curriculum--covering topics like race & social justice, environmental conservation and civic engagement--in partnership with the San Diego Unified School District and trained hundreds of instructors in its use. Managed Stories of Service youth filmmaker and Independent Lens community cinema programs, establishing partnerships with local businesses, nonprofits and cultural institutions.

experiences.title: Environmental Education Volunteer
experiences.description:
- Organized and led local committee to build, operate and fundraise for town's first library.
- Co-created national teacher training program on participatory education techniques.
- Taught hands-on environmental education classes to over 300 primary school students.
- Served on board responsible for evaluating proposals and allocating $120K in USAID grants.

education.school: Duke University - The Fuqua School of Business
education.description:
President of the Duke MBA Net Impact Club. 
Entrepreneurship and Innovation Lead, Duke Sustainable Business & Social Impact Conference. 
Teaching assistant for management communications, operations, economics and accounting.

volunteer_work.title: Big Sister
volunteer_work.company: Big Brothers Big Sisters of NYC

volunteer_work.title: Volunteer
volunteer_work.description:
- Urban Farming with East New York Farms  
- Women's English Conversation Partner at the Arab American Family Support Center
- Story-capturer at the New Jewish Home

recommendations:
Charles Scrase



I'm fortunate to have had the opportunity to work closely with Jessie for several years.  She is a strong leader, with a deep passion for driving business and social impact, and with an aptitude for people management and coaching.  She also has a strong strategic mindset, as evidenced by the business she built for Google over a number of years.  On top of all of this, she's great with customers, and can build strong and lasting partnerships.  I highly recommend her.

Luke Rodehorst



Creativity is the driving force behind Jessie's leadership, approach to the task at hand and vision for the future. As a people manager, Jessie finds the creative spark in her teammates and matches it with where it can drive meaningful business value and career development. For example, Jessie encouraged me to lead with my storytelling skills in our client engagements - something that was meaningful for me personally and proved effective in working with our partners. She approaches problem solving with curiosity to drive results, often times in a bespoke way. She orients her team and her work behind a north star outcome that's both inspirational and ambitious - something you want to work towards. Her keen self awareness provides the foundation and perspective to be an empathetic leader who embraces the challenge to tackle complex problems with focus and creativity. You'd be lucky to work with her!
